intro: Teucrium polium subsp. flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green germander, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its aromatic foliage contains essential oils, contributing to its use in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats.
